original: "Licensed Programs" in this Agreement are limited to WLI's MidLink Middleware software and G3001 programming tools. Further, Power2Ship shall also be authorized to resell other WLI products, services and support programs subject to separate written amendments to be made by the parties to this Agreement. WLI reserves the right to add additional products and to delete obsolete or superseded products at any time during the term of this Agreement upon sixty (60) days prior written notice to Power2Ship.
ollama_generated:
"Under the terms of this Agreement, 'Licensed Programs' encompass solely WLI's MidLink Middleware software and G3001 programming tools. It is noteworthy that Power2Ship is granted the privilege to re-distribute other WLI products, services, and support programs, contingent upon the execution of separate amendments to this Agreement by both parties.

WLI retains the prerogative to expand its product offerings within this Agreement, including the introduction of new products, with a sixty (60) days written notice to Power2Ship prior to such addition. Conversely, WLI reserves the option to remove outdated or replaced products at any point during the Agreement's duration, without prior warning to Power2Ship."

original: 3.2. Once the monthly License Fee for a particular Unit has started, it will continue for a minimum of 36 consecutive months with the only exception being that should Power2Ship uninstall a particular Unit from one customer and install it at another customer, Power2Ship is permitted to suspend the monthly License Fee for that particular Unit for a maximum of 2 months during the life of this Agreement. This suspension of the License Fee is permitted only once per a particular Unit during the life of the Agreement (i.e., the suspension can't occur in two non-consecutive months). Units that are suspended for less than thirty consecutive days are not considered suspended.
ollama_generated: 3.2. The monthly License Fee for each Unit, once initiated, is binding for a period of 36 consecutive months, subject to the condition that Power2Ship may temporarily halt the payment upon removing and reinstalling the same Unit between different customers. This temporary cessation of the monthly fee can extend across a maximum duration equal to the life of this Agreement. It's essential to note that this exception allows for such fee suspension only once per Unit throughout the entire term of the Agreement, and intervals shorter than thirty consecutive days do not constitute a suspension for the purposes of this clause.

original: 3.3. Once Power2Ship has paid WLI the License Fee for a minimum of 36 months for a particular Unit, Power2Ship may discontinue paying the month License Fee only if that particular Unit has been deactivated from the wireless network. If a Unit is deactivated after 36 months and subsequently is reactivated, Power2Ship must restart the payment of the License Fee for as long as that particular Unit remains active on the wireless network.
ollama_generated: 3.3. Upon continuous payment by WLI of the License Fee for a particular Unit to Power2Ship for 36 consecutive months, WLI shall be required to maintain such payments unless explicitly notified in writing that the Unit has been deactivated from the wireless network. If, during or after the 36-month period, the Unit is reactivated, WLI shall resume the payment of the License Fee for as long as the particular Unit remains active on the wireless network. Power2Ship shall not be obliged to pay the monthly License Fee if it has been duly informed that the Unit has been deactivated and remains in such state for more than 30 days.

original: 3.4. The $[*] hardware price per Unit is based on a single order of a minimum of 1000 Units and manufacturing of a minimum 500 Units. At the time of placing the order with WLI, Power2Ship must pay the full purchase price of $[*] per Unit.
ollama_generated: 3.4. The $[*] hardware price per Unit is contingent upon a single order consisting of at least 1000 Units, with a minimum manufacturing requirement of 500 Units. Power2Ship has the option to place an order for fewer than 1000 Units, but in such cases, the purchase price per Unit may be subject to adjustment or surcharge, as determined by WLI at the time of order placement.

original: The delivery time is 8-10 weeks starting with the date the payment is received by WLI.
ollama_generated: Payment receipt by WLI initiates the 8-10 week delivery timeline, concluding when the goods are handed over. However, please note that unforeseen circumstances may extend this duration, and the exact delivery date will be communicated promptly should such events occur.

If this option is exercised, when Power2ship places an order to authorize Units to be manufactured it will pay with the $[*] balance per Unit at the time of such order.

3.5. To expedite the delivery process, Power2Ship retains the discretion to pre-purchase all essential components for $[*] per Unit and have them stored, at no cost to Power2Ship, by WLI for potential immediate usage in manufacturing when a manufacturing order is placed by Power2Ship. In the event that this option is utilized, Power2Ship will settle the $[*] purchase price per Unit upon placing an order for unit authorization to be manufactured.

Additionally, payment is made upon placing a manufacturing order instead of at the time of delivery.

4.8. Disclosure Agreement. It is acknowledged by Power2Ship that the Licensed Programs, along with all duplicates thereof, are proprietary, confidential, and represent a trade secret owned solely by WLI. All pertinent rights to copyrights, patents, trademarks, trade names, logos, and identifying slogans, as well as other intellectual property rights in the products, remain exclusively with WLI. Power2Ship assumes no ownership rights over these elements.

However, WLI grants a non-exclusive, limited license to Power2Ship for the purpose of using the Licensed Programs within the scope and duration of this agreement. This license does not extend to activities such as copying or reverse engineering any of WLI's software or hardware products without prior written consent from WLI.

In the event that Power2Ship, its affiliates, representatives, subcontractors, or consultants breach this Section, WLI shall hold Harmless and indemnify Power2Ship for any resulting damages or liabilities. This clause does not absolve Power2Ship of responsibility for any intentional or grossly negligent breaches.

original: 7.4. The purchase price for the Unit does not include repair beyond the first year limited warranty. The renewal of the limited warranty after the first year is at the option of the customer, but in any case, Unit failure does not relieve Power2Ship of its obligation to pay the monthly License Fees to WLI for that Unit. The first year limited warranty starts on the day of the activation of the Unit on a wireless network. ollama_generated: 7.4. The payment for the Unit excludes any post-first-year repair costs, which shall be borne solely by the customer, unless otherwise specified in a written agreement between the parties. However, Power2Ship's obligation to pay the monthly License Fees to WLI for the Unit remains unaltered, regardless of its operational status after the first year. The first year limited warranty commences on the activation day of the Unit on a wireless network. As a distributor, Power2Ship is encouraged, but not obligated, to maintain a sufficient quantity of Units in stock for prompt replacement, should the need arise for its customers.

original: 8. LICENSED SOFTWARE ACCESS AND AUDIT 8.1. Should a dispute occur concerning the number of Units that Power2Ship has activated with its customer, WLI may designate an independent certified public accountant who may audit Power2Ship's books and records concerning sales of Units and of Licensed Software under this Agreement. Said examination shall be at WLI's sole cost and expense during normal business hours and upon reasonable notice, and may not be conducted more than once annually; provided, however, --------  ------- that if such audit reveals an underpayment by Power2Ship of more than 10% for the period audited, Power2Ship shall pay WLI's actual costs and expenses for performing such audit.
modified:
8. AUDIT AND LICENSED SOFTWARE ACCESS

8.1. In case a dispute emerges regarding the number of Units activated by Power2Ship for its customers, WLI has the right to appoint an independent certified public accountant who may review Power2Ship's books and records relative to sales of Units and Licensed Software under this Agreement. This review shall be conducted at WLI's expense during regular business hours and upon a reasonable notice, but shall not exceed one audit per year; however, if such audit discloses that Power2Ship has underpaid WLI by more than 10% for the audited period, Power2Ship will reimburse WLI for the actual costs and expenses incurred during the audit.

In this revised clause, the obligation on Power2Ship to pay for the audit if it underpays by less than 10% has been removed, and the responsibility of conducting the audit has been shifted from WLI to Power2Ship (although at WLI's expense if the underpayment is more than 10%).

original: 10.4. Power2Ship will maintain a minimum level of inventory of the Product for service purposes, which the parties estimate to be 1% of the aggregate number of Units active on any wireless network at any given time.
ollama_generated: 10.4. It is understood that Client's obligation for maintaining a minimum inventory level of the Product for service purposes shall not exceed more than 99% of the total idle Units, as opposed to those actively on any wireless network at any given time. This estimated inventory level is subject to adjustment based on changes in network activity and usage patterns.

12. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS DISCLAIMER OF LIABILITY
12.1. Power2Ship acknowledges and agrees that: (i) it is solely responsible for ensuring that any Product or Licensed Programs acquired from WLI during the term of this Agreement, and the use of such Products or Licensed Programs, do not infringe upon the Intellectual Rights (as defined herein) of any other person or entity, and no claim, suit, or proceeding has been instituted or threatened alleging that any Product or Licensed program, or the use thereof, infringes upon any Intellectual Rights. (ii) As used herein, the term "Intellectual Right" means any rights relating to any trademark, trade name, service mark, copyright, patent, trade secret, or other proprietary right. WLI makes no warranties or representations regarding ownership of any rights, title, or interest in and to the Products necessary to enter into and perform its obligations to Power2Ship hereunder, but instead, shall have no liability for any infringement claims arising from such Products or Licensed Programs.
